001package edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.adapter;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.View;
006import android.view.ViewGroup;
007import android.widget.Adapter;
008import android.widget.ArrayAdapter;
009import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
010import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
011import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.R;
012import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.controller.PatternReaderFragment;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.databinding.ItemRowsBinding;
014import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.model.entity.Row;
015import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.model.pojo.RowWithStitches;
016import java.util.List;
017
018/**
019 * This {@link Adapter} is the joining element between the data and the view model. This class links
020 * {@link RowWithStitches} to the view allowing the {@link PatternReaderFragment} to display a
021 * particular row with a particular set of stitches when a pattern is called up.
022 */
023public class RowsAdapter extends ArrayAdapter<RowWithStitches> {
024
025  private final LayoutInflater inflater;
026  private final Context context;
027
028  /**
029   * This constructor inflates the layout for the rows that will show in
030   * {@link PatternReaderFragment}
031   *
032   * @param context {@link Context} is the global information from the activity that allows us to
033   *                share information across multiple fragments
034   * @param rows    The set of {@link Row} that is linked to a particular pattern.
035   */
036  public RowsAdapter(@NonNull Context context, @NonNull List<RowWithStitches> rows) {
037    super(context, R.layout.item_rows, rows);
038    inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context);
039    this.context = context;
040  }
041
042  @NonNull
043  @Override
044  public View getView(int position, @Nullable View convertView, @NonNull ViewGroup parent) {
045    RowWithStitches row = getItem(position);
046    ItemRowsBinding binding = (convertView != null)
047        ? ItemRowsBinding.bind(convertView)
048        : ItemRowsBinding.inflate(inflater, parent, false);
049    StitchesAdapter adapter = new StitchesAdapter(context, row.getStitches());
050    binding.getRoot().setAdapter(adapter);
051    return binding.getRoot();
052  }
053
054}
